name: Discord.RSS
description: Discord RSS bot with customizable feeds

DRSS_BOT_TOKEN.description: Discord BOT token. Get it here: https://discordapp.com/developers/applications/

DRSS_BOT_PREFIX.description: The prefix of your RSS feed bot. E.g. summoning the bot is done via ~rsshelp

DRSS_BOT_CONTROLLER_IDS.description: Owner ID(s), separate multiple with a comma

DRSS_FEEDS_REFRESH_TIME_MINUTES.description: Refresh rate of your RSS feed bot.

DRSS_FEEDS_DEFAULT_MESSAGE.description: Default message. You can do role pings with <@DISCORD_ROLE_ID>.

DRSS_WEB_REDIRECT_URI.description: Insert the domain name appending /authorize. Example on heroku: APPNAME.herokuapp.com/authorize

DRSS_WEB_CLIENT_ID.description: This is the ID that you can find on the general information page. This should only contain numbers.

DRSS_WEB_CLIENT_SECRET.description: Default message. You can do role pings with <@DISCORD_ROLE_ID>.

DRSS_WEB_ENABLED.description: WARNING! if you enable this, make sure that you fill in all of the DRSS_WEB_ and have read the WIKI troughly. Make sure to NOT use worker, but instead always use WEB in the sources tab. Finnally use something to keep your web dyno up like uptimerobot (free online software).

GITHUB_REPO.description: Copy part of the link after `https://github.com/` (e.g `chaNcharge/Discord.RSS`) and paste it here, required for auto updates with Scheduler!

GITHUB_REPO_BRANCH.description: The branch of your fork to update, required for auto updates with Scheduler!

GITHUB_SECRET_TOKEN.description: Copy GitHub personal access token here, required for auto updates with Scheduler! You can get a personal access token here: https://github.com/settings/tokens

UPSTREAM_REPO.description: The link to the upstream repo to update from, leave this as is for DiscordRSS

UPSTREAM_BRANCH.description: The branch of the upstream repo, leave this as is for DiscordRSS
